title: I'm tired of hugging the tower while Zed gets to free farm and harass me endlessly for 10-20 minutes
body:
Am I the only one tired of this? The majority of mages go through the same thing because they don't have the mana to fight back. Mages were penalized with the mana changes to stop them from braindead farming. But Zed gets to do this for free. To top it off, he has no mana and tons of damage and escapes from ganks.


Can anyone explain how this is fair?

Imagine having AoE abilities and not actually using them to hit champions AND wave.

Wasn't that why mages were so OP? Having large AoEs that deal a lot of damage? Why is it then that everytime somebody cries about how unfair being a mage is and everybody is just shitting on them that suddenly stops being a thing? 

Seriously. You don't use spells on cooldown, you learn to manage your mana and you learn that C O M P O N E N T S exist. Know what builds into Armguard AND Chapter? Amp Tome. It's cheap, it's good. Same with Cloth Armor. Get 1 or maybe even 2 Cloth Armors, finish your Chapter. You do not need Armguard early in the game if you cannot deal with your mana otherwise. Also use your god damn ranged auto attacks because those are good at pushing too. Focus casters first, keep auto attacking melees. Learn to manage the wave, look out for tells in the enemy behaviour. A Zed W Q is always telegraphed if you try to look for it for example.

If you don't know how, here let me help you:

Remember that he wants to hit a double shuriken and understand that there are only a limited amount of angles he can use to do that while waves are crashing. Like if he stands to the right of the wave he will most likely throw a W into the minions, then E Q into your direction to hit you with both Q's. If he does it straight up in the wave then it becomes even easier. 

Then there are Zed players who won't use your W at all unless it is to all in you. Those are scarier, because they will likely jump you with their E first to slow, then follow it up immediately with a double shuriken. To avoid that you need to move unpredictably. Try walking forward instead of backwards to your tower, because that's what most people would do. Play mindgames, throw him out of his routine. Punish whenever W is on cooldown. Remember that minions reduce shuriken damage and never stand close to the shadow. 

When he ults you and has a W out, try throwing out your spells where he comes out of his R. Stuff like Cassio ult are amazing at this. He is always behind you afterwards and if you land a CC or even walk in the right direction you can almost dodge all of his damage already. If he does the instant switcheroo don't panic and still try moving unpredictably. If he just auto attacks you down you should just back off, it shouldn't kill you at that point.


But you're just going to say "no but that's not how it goes" and my time will be wasted.

No, but you can buy Cloth armor, which builds into Seeker’s Armguard, which builds into Zhonya’s, a core mage item. Yes, you lose out on mana from Lost Chapter, but part of dealing with an opponent who has a stronger early lane is knowing when and how to build against them, even if it means delaying another item. It’s simile to how Malzahar, Warwick, and Skarner all make the enemy have to pay the “QSS tax.”

Lethality is flat armor pen. Buying armor reduces it’s effectiveness. And early on, Cloth Armor alone provides more armor than Serrated Dirk can penetrate.

The formula is, according to the wiki:

> Flat Armor Penetration = Lethality × (0.6 + 0.4 × level ÷ 18)

Serrated Dirk gives 10 lethality. At level 6, that’s penetrating 7.3 armor. Duskblade of Draktharr gives 21 lethality, so at the same level would penetrate 15.4 armor.

Cloth armor gives 15 armor. Congrats, at level 6 against a level 6 Zed, you can negate the Lethality of an 1100 gold item (Dirk) and a 2900 gold item (Duskblade) with a 300 gold buy.

What? You've probably never played against a Diamond+ Zed main.

Zed puts his W on top of you and hits you with E + at least one Q. It's unavoidable.

That combo deals 473 damage at level 7 with only Serrated Dirk. Casters have about 44 armor and 960 health with Chapter. Lethality reduces the armor to 37. Total damage taken after armor is around 347. That's 36% of your max health.

If he lands two shurikens, it does about 443 damage, or about 46% of your max health. This is low enough for him to just ult and kill you once his cooldowns are back up.

You now **also** have to play around his shadow, because it effectively zones you from the wave, and you're creating distance from your turret by side stepping around it to continue CSing. Zed can use this for cover while he picks up some CS before the shadow drops, then get the rest from a safe range with Q, only missing maybe one or two.

Absolute worst case scenario, he does this twice and always misses the second Q, and the third time he can kill you with his ult.
